interface.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Channel.Interface.DTMF

arg.name: stream_id
arg.tp:docstring: A stream ID as defined in the StreamedMedia channel type

tp:docstring.p: Start sending a DTMF tone on this stream. Where possible, the tone will continue until StopTone is called. On certain protocols, it may only be possible to send events with a predetermined length. In this case, the implementation may emit a fixed-length tone, and the StopTone method call should return NotAvailable.
In common with RFC4733, the event codes are defined as follows:

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.InvalidArgument
tp:error.tp:docstring: The given stream ID was invalid.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.NotAvailable
tp:error.tp:docstring: The requested event is not available on this stream.

method.name: StopTone

arg.name: stream_id
arg.tp:docstring: A stream ID as defined in the StreamedMedia channel type

method.tp:docstring: Stop sending any DTMF tone which has been started using the StartTone method. If there is no current tone, this method will do nothing.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.InvalidArgument
tp:error.tp:docstring: The given stream ID was invalid.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.NotAvailable
tp:error.tp:docstring: Continuous tones are not supported by this stream.

interface.tp:docstring: An interface that gives a Channel the ability to send DTMF signalling tones over audio streams which have been established using the StreamedMedia channel type.
